title: When is Coronation Street back on TV as it takes a week-long break?
text:
Coronation Street will be back on screens very soon (Picture: ITV)

If you’re a fan of Coronation Street, no doubt you will have noticed its absence from the airwaves in recent days.

In fact the soap’s been missing from its usual slot since last Wednesday, as the normal schedules give way to sport.

We don’t have to wait much longer for its return though – so just when is it back?

Here’s what you need to know…

When is Coronation Street back on TV?

Here’s the good news folks – your regular dose of Corrie returns to the airwaves on Wednesday.

Expect heartbreak when the show returns as Sinead loses her cancer battle (Picture: ITV)

And that’s not all – as it’s coming back with a double bill of episodes tomorrow, with one at 7.30pm and one at 8.30pm.

There’s also an hour-long episode set to air this Friday at 7.30pm – while you’re also getting double bills next Monday (21 October) and Wednesday (23 October), and an extra episode next Thursday (24th) at 8.30pm as well as another hour-long episode on Friday 25th.

Expect heartbreak in Weatherfield after Sinead (Katie McGlynn) faces her final days with family and friends as she loses her cancer battle.

Why was Coronation Street off for a week?

Corrie has been absent from our screens in recent days to make way for England’s Euro 2020 qualifying matches.

Friday saw the show take a back seat as the team took on the Czech Republic in their bid to win a place in next year’s tournament, losing 2-1 to the Czech team.

Monday night saw Corrie getting the night off as England faced Bulgaria, winning 6-0 in a match which was marred by Bulgaria fans levelling racist abuse at the team, leading to the game being halted twice.

The live coverage also saw Emmerdale being shunted from the schedules – although that returns to screens tonight with a bumper hour-long episode from 7pm.
